newsitem.title: GERMANY: Berlin opera sacks musician for Hitler "joke".
newsitem.headline: Berlin opera sacks musician for Hitler "joke".

text.p: A leading German opera company said on Monday it had sacked one of its musicians who signed a hotel bill with the name of Adolf Hitler while on a tour of Israel.
A spokeswoman for the Berlin Opera said the 54-year-old double bass player, who had been ordered to return to Berlin, would receive immediate notice of his dismissal.

The incident, in the bar of a Tel Aviv hotel in the early hours of Saturday, provoked a storm of protest in Israel and a demonstration by Holocaust survivors outside the Tel Aviv opera house during the company's performance later that day.
Opera officials, issuing hurried apologies for what they called an isolated incident, said the musician had been drinking heavily before he signed the bill in Hitler's name.
But Germany's mass-circulation daily Bild newspaper, carrying the story as a front-page item, said research by Israeli journalists had shown he had only had two beers in the hotel bar.

Other German newspapers were equally unwilling to pass the affair off as a joke, with some suggesting it showed just how deeply anti-Semitism ran in Germany and that it added fire to the debate over the role of ordinary Germans in the Holocaust.
"One musician has shown us that doubts about our freedom from blame are not entirely unjustified," the Hamburger Abendblatt newspaper said in an editorial.
